text: Climbing Mount Everest, also known as Sagarmatha and Chomolungma, is a dream for many alpinists.
The challenging ascent of K2, or Mount Godwin Austen, is considered one of the world's toughest.
Kangchenjunga, the third highest mountain, straddles the border between Nepal and India.
Lhotse is directly connected to Mount Everest via the South Col.
Many expeditions target Makalu, the fifth highest peak in the world.
Cho Oyu is a popular peak for commercial expeditions due to its relatively easier ascent.
Dhaulagiri I, towering in the Himalayas, is a formidable challenge.
Manaslu offers breathtaking views of the surrounding Nepalese landscape.
Nanga Parbat, known as 'Killer Mountain', is one of the most dangerous to climb.
Annapurna I was the first 8,000-meter peak to be successfully climbed.
Gasherbrum I, also called Hidden Peak, is part of the Gasherbrum massif.
Climbers often mistake Broad Peak for its higher neighbors, K2 and Gasherbrum I.
Gasherbrum II is the third highest peak of the Gasherbrum group.
Shishapangma, or Xixabangma, is the lowest of the fourteen eight-thousanders.
The iconic Matterhorn stands proudly in the Alps, bordering Switzerland and Italy.
Mont Blanc, also known as Monte Bianco, is the highest mountain in the Alps.
Mount Fuji, or Fuji-san, is Japan's highest peak and a sacred site.
Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania is the highest single free-standing mountain in the world.
Denali, formerly Mount McKinley, is North America's highest peak.
Pico de Orizaba, or Citlaltépetl, is the highest mountain in Mexico.
